TopicTitle: This is what it looks like when you replace the fairing texture with the Orange tank texture

Articles.Content:
Very cool. I could see this being used for a space shuttle tank, +rep.

For your retexture project, would you consider retexturing the Mystery Goo container slightly so it didn't so resemble an RCS tank?

> 
> Very cool. I could see this being used for a space shuttle tank, +rep.
> For your retexture project, would you consider retexturing the Mystery Goo container slightly so it didn't so resemble an RCS tank?

Hahaha I'll write that down xD
The top of that looks quite cool.
It does look good ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) What is the plate at the bottom?

> 
> It does look good ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) What is the plate at the bottom?

That would be the fairing base.

It's amazing I can say that tank is made completely out of stock parts. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) - I'm a die hard stock part only player, but texture packs and visual enhancers I'm all for.

> 
> It does look good ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) What is the plate at the bottom?

Both the bottom and the top are made from fairings. They're purdy :3

Well, I'd say you've just earned your spot on "The Kerbal Fashion Weekly"! Seriously though, that's pretty cool. Wish there was an in stock paint shop. Anyone ever play "Midnight Club"? (old PS2 game)
Very nice. Might I also add you could run a cylindrical one all the way up the side to hide the individual tanks inside!
